Who we are and what we do

We are a multi faceted company with forays into enterprise software for the manufacturing industry as well as content creation applications for mobile platforms. We believe that enriching experiences can be created when technology meets the liberal arts. http://jump4loves.com This philosophy constitutes our work culture and everything around it. Our two major lines of work i.e. enterprise software and the app business are created with the latest cutting edge technology at their hearts and aim to face peculiar enterprise as well as consumer needs head on. You will find that our product line resounds with the essence of these three words:Â Simple, Beautiful and Profound.

item.title: TOPSPIN (Textile Spinning ERP)
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
The one ERP for Spinners

 

[dt_button size="big" animation="none" color="" link="http://www.atwspl.com/Audio_Visual_Presentation.zip" target_blank="true"]Download Presentation[/dt_button][dt_button size="big" link="http://atwspl.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/06/TOPSPIN_Broacher.pdf" style="download" color="silver"]Download Brochure[/dt_button]

      [dt_stripe type="3" bg_color="" bg_image="" bg_position="" bg_repeat="" bg_cover="true" bg_attachment="true" padding_top="" padding_bottom="" margin_top="" margin_bottom=""]

Client Testimonials

[dt_testimonials type="slider" category="" order="" orderby="" number="6" autoslide="0"] [/dt_stripe] [dt_gap height="20" /] TOPSPIN ERP has been conceived, designed, developed & implemented by ATWSPL in the larger interest of textile spinning industry.Â TOPSPIN is seamlessly integrated to incorporate all the business processes & activities for managing spinning mills in a multi user and multi location environment.Â This end to end integration begins from ascertaining production plan, generating BOM, raw-material procurements to sales and debtor/creditors management. Hence, TOPSPIN completes both R [requisition] to P [procurement] & O [order] to C [consumption] cycles.Â TOPSPIN is capable of providing absolute management controls to the spinners in terms of cost, production & quality. ThisÂ consist of budgetary allocations for the monthly expenses and an instant MIS indicating variances with actual expenses that as such figured out of financial accounting [book keeping].Â Apart from budgetary MIS, TOPSPIN evaluate cost of each and every sales contract with aÂ customisableÂ cost sheet and display variances of individual element of cost with actual cost incurred while completing the sales cycle, which we call a "Cost-MIS"
TOPSPIN ERP allows users to obtain enterprise wide information in an integrated manner so that commercial and technical issues can be addressed concurrently.Â TOPSPIN ERPÂ takes care of all the five resources [M] i.e. Market, Materials, Machine, Man & Money. TOPSPIN ERP can deliver BPM [Business Process Management] that helps businesses make efficient use of their financial, human, material and other resources and contains the concept of a control or feed- back loop and alert business users that helps guide the business towards its objectives. [dt_gap height="20" /] [dt_divider style="thin" /] [dt_gap height="20" /]

Strategic Management Information System

TOPSPIN ERP SMIS Technologies can deliver instant information pertaining to top management review and hence such information is strategic in nature. Top management without being involved in day to day affair can retrieve summary as well as detailed information irrespective of their location. ATWSPL believes that MIS is a post-mortem process as when the variance reports arrive, the damages have been done and cannot be reversed in most cases. Thus we really wanted to change the way that the industry goes about analysing MIS reports. We have now come up with our proprietary "Predictive MIS" that we call Strategic Management Information System or SMIS. In this technology we have successfully managed to come up with what we can predict monthly variances before the month has passed by analysing trends in the actuals. What this does is that by looking what your actuals are shaping up to be at the end of the month, you can better adjust you processes during the month to get the "MINIMUM VARIANCES". [caption id="attachment_393" align="aligncenter" width="820"] Production MIS Report[/caption] [caption id="attachment_396" align="aligncenter" width="820"] Top Selling Products[/caption] [caption id="attachment_392" align="aligncenter" width="820"] Power MIS Report[/caption] [caption id="attachment_398" align="aligncenter" width="820"] Sales MIS[/caption]

[dt_divider style="thin" /]

[dt_gap height="20" /]

Modules

  • General Setup To Create Plant & Machinery, Fiber, Yarn Products, Customer, Vendor, Service Providers & Other Master Entries
  • Budgeting
  • Costing & Production Planning
  • Marketing & CRM
  • Manufacturing [Production Control]
  • Quality Control
  • Maintenance
  • Engineering
  • Raw-Materials Management
  • Store-Materials Management
  • Sales & Dispatches
  • Inventories Of Yarn, Fiber, Waste, WIP, Stores & Scrap
  • Human Resource Management
  • Financial Accounting
  • Strategic Management Information System

[dt_gap height="20" /]

[dt_divider style="thin" /]

[dt_gap height="20" /]

Reflex Web/Smartphone App for instant updates

We've developed our own smartphone (iOS/Android) application to keep you up to date on the latest updates from your organisation. This application is also available on the web. This application also serves as an enterprise-wide communication system and an organiser to keep you up and running while you face your busy schedules. We also give the user complete freedom to select what updates they want toÂ receiveÂ and what they don't hence assuring that you'll only be updated about the things you're concerned about. We've also tried to keep this application as simple and minimalistic as we could, so that those that are not very familiar with the use of electronic devices and web applications can also get along with it easily. [dt_gap height="20" /]

item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
OrganisationÂ Name:

Avadh Texwood & Systems [P] Ltd.,

Abbreviated Name:

ATWSPL

Year of Incorporation

1992-93

Registered Office

1st and 2nd Floor, D-15, Rajaji Puram, LUCKNOW-226017 [Uttar Pradesh] India.

Telephone Nos.

+91-522-4048466

E-mail:

info@atwspl.com ,Â services@atwspl.com

Name Of CEO & Board Of Directors

Chaiman Satya Vrat Misra [Textile Technocrat]
Vice Chairman Trinetra Bajpai [Business Development]
CEO & M.D. Prem Shanker Bajpai [Business & Project Administrator]
Director Priya Vrat Misra [IT Consultant]
Director Upma Bajpai [HR Consultant]
 

Specialization

ATWSPL is specializing in the area of information technology exclusively for textiles and in this process, the organization has endeavored to design textile specific, customized ERP Solutions.

Domain Expertise

ATWSPL initiatives specialize in the area of information technology exclusively for textiles and in this process, the organization has endeavored to design textile specific ERP Solutions. Textile in general has âNâ number of variables and hence, ERP solution design & development essentially requires:
  • Textile knowledge base
  • IT expertise
ATWSPL is enriched with in-depth knowledge base for textiles. The domain information is purposefully applied to convert complicated techno-commercial procedures and hard-core textile technology into the latest software languages. Resultantly, the outcome is âTOPSPINâ ERP solution available in multi user environment for the spinners as RDBMS application. ATWSPL has provided a vibrant platform for textile consultants and IT professionals since 1998-99 to interact and conceive most appropriate and feasible information technology solution. ATWSPL efforts are dedicated with the careful selection of automation, integration, analysis in the required framework of overall business requirement leveraging specific needs and day-to-day business activity that incorporates procedures and priorities of the organization in practice Indian/local rules and regulations as well as domestic & export market conditions yet maintaining best international practices.

ATWSPL Fact Sheet

ATWSPL has provided a vibrant platform for textile consultants and IT professionals since 1998-99 to interact and conceive most appropriate and feasible information technology solution for textile industry. ATWSPL has designed customized integrated application software exclusively for textile spinning industry. ATWSPL efforts are dedicated with the careful selection of automation, integration, analysis in the required framework of overall business requirement leveraging day-to-day business activity that incorporates procedures and priorities of the organization in practice. ATWSPL solutions are hence, able to directly address the specific needs of the organization in consideration with Indian/local rules and regulations as well as domestic & export market conditions yet maintaining best international practices. âTOPSPINâ ERP belongs to ATWSPL customers as this software is conceived, designed and developed in the industry shop floor itself with the help of ATWSPL infrastructure. Industry commercial & technical professionals and user had consistent interaction neck to neck with the ATWSPL skill that indeed, established âTOPSPINâ, as the most usersâ friendly and trusted solution amongst the spinners. âTOPSPINâ as such is evolved in a natural sequence in the industry platform itself. Looking to ATWSPL efforts NITRA [Northern India Textile Research Association] linked to Ministry of Textile, Govt. Of India, has awarded their official membership. Ministry of Textiles, Govt. Of India has also invited to address âTEXINFOTECHâ 2000 an âInternational Conference over IT in Textilesâ as one of the twelve distinguished speakers all over the world. ATWSPL has also interacted at CII platforms during âTEXCON 2002â & 2005 and shared views with the renowned textile professionals. ATWSPL is currently working over âMicrosoftâ platform that consist Windows operating system, .net visual studio 2005 frame work as front end and SQL server 2005 as back end. Since, ATWSPL has multi layered architecture with a separate data access layer using ADO. net, Oracle or any other ODBC supported database can be linked. ATWSPL has adopted an incremental implementation methodology instead of water fall model that proved to be well supported by the customers. sses and add value to resiliently strive and acquire improved profits.

Evolution, Initiative & Accomplishments

ATWSPL designing process began with the development of a textile maintenance module for a Ludhiana based spinning mill and subsequently various modules were developed and integrated before they finally culminated in to ERP. Few key employers of ATWSPL IT solutions are summarized as under: The employer M/s.RCIL is the manufacturer and exporter of synthetic and blended yarn âATWSPL was appointed to design, develop and implement an integrated application for complete commercial activities performed at RCIL. This project consist Rawmaterial, Store materials procurement, Sales, HR & payroll, Accounts departments integration. The employer M/s.SRSL Group is the manufacturer and exporter of synthetic and cotton blended yarn âATWSPL was appointed to design, develop and implement an application that can integrate their sales centers all over the India to their Udaipur based head office. The head office was to be connected to the Dungarpur based three manufacturing units with different product mix. The employer CSL is a highly dynamic organization manufacturing 100% Cotton, grey, single yarn with a deep understanding of global textile industry. Set up in Northern India, Cheema Spintex is a 100% Export Oriented Unit catering to most quality conscious knitted and woven fabric manufacturers and approved vendors of leading apparel brands across various continents. In order to improve resource management and introduce organizational efficiency inter departmental communication, better customer management CSL has appointed us to deploy ERP solution with the modules comprising costing, budgeting, marketing, procurement, HR, production, quality, maintenance, engineering management, sales & excise, Financial management, MIS and strategic information system.

item.title: General Masters
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
System Configuration

This allows tight integration amongst accounts, excise, store, raw material, sales and personnel departments so that the required data may flow automatically and ensure de-compartmentalization. This also helps to produce instant information and abolish communication gaps amongst the department irrespective of their locations. [hr]

Creation Of General Masters

The application allows market segmentation country, state or station wise with respect to sales, procurement and employees hired. The application is suitable for corporate structure where the company and its subsidiary may be created and linked e.g. various production center, sales offices, depot, centers & head office / regional offices. The currency master allows the application to become multi-currency with exchange rates for convenient conversions into local currency. System creates general master entries like bank, currencies and other masters for demographic segmentation. System identifies the different color and shades of fiber and yarns [hr]

Auto E-Mail:

Auto e-mail sending to the vendor and customer with the required formats as an attachment [e.g. orders sending immediately after its approval to the concerned vendor e-mail ids]. [hr]

Plant Set-Up

System creates section wise different types of machineries with their make, models and store the following information:
  • Erection details
  • Commissioning details
  • Capacity
  • Output capabilities
  • Expected life
System allows assembly creation System indicates assembly wise installed machines [hr]

Creation Of Fiber & Yarn Master:

Textile industry has ânâ number of variables with the huge variety of fiber and yarns. Fiber may be Natural or manmade. Natural fiber consist cotton, wool, hemp, jute, silk etc
  • System has the ability to handle different varieties of fiber
  • System takes care of natural fiber with respect to the location [station] with distinct press running numbers and type of ginning e.g. RG / SG
  • System handle various types of fiber contamination and impurities
  • System has also the ability to create different types of yarn with respect to grey and dyed classification.
  • System considers various type of yarn count system, ply, blends and end uses like weaving, hosiery with respect to the production rules like carded or combed yarn
  • System can identify the yarn with its short name to be used during production life cycle but linked to a separate displayable name and the name can be used during invoicing
Industry specific âTOPSPINâ takes cares of all such requirements in totality.

item.title: Budgeting & MIS
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Every Industry has its own procedure with allocated cost of elements to arrive at the product cost.Â  Budgetary controls are important to restrict cost variations so that the organization may gain profits and break even must be evident. Under this scenario, the raw-material [fiber] and the finished product [yarn] nomenclature with respect to their different varieties, coding system, manufacturing and selling pattern must be considered properly to arrive at the specific budget. âTOPSPINâ industry specific ERP solution has the provisions for following types of required budgets suitable for the spinning of yarn. [hr]

Sale Budget & MIS

There are different types of sales e.g. yarn, waste, scrap and raw-materials. Yarn sales are further categorized into export and domestic sales. Export sales consist direct as well as merchant / deemed export. Domestic sales has a direct sales to the customer, or consignment / transit sales. Direct sales may be of fresh yarn or a second quality / alarm materials. Sales budgets are prepared on monthly basis considering order to make [sold] and make to order [unsold] scenario. The budgets are prepared count / sale type with corresponding quantities and applicable rates to arrive at total sale budget. MIS reports is prepared on its own. MIS considered the actual values for the month and compare with the budgeted figures indicating variances in %. Looking to the current trend within the month, MIS provides predictive figures for the month. [hr]

Production Budget & MIS

In order to elaborate the industry specific requirement, letâs take the illustration of production budget. First of all the application must have the provision for particular type of machinery having a defined production rate e.g. in ring frame section the ring frame no 6 of one make may have different production rate defined as gms / spindle shift [GSS] if compared to ring frame no 27 of a different make. The data of GSS in production budget is derived from budgeted production norms which is dependent on actual count, spindle speed, efficiency, utilization, twist multiplier [TM]. Hence, in the industry specific application the budgeting has to address various industry norms and procedure and a set of general rules cannot address the requirement. This is the illustration of ring frame machinery while carding, draw frame, comber, speed frame, autoconer have different variables to address with. Similarly open end machinery, draw-frame, carding and blow room are considered. Production budget data is derived from the monthly sales budget. Like sales production MIS is auto prepared with the predictive figures. [hr]

Raw-Material Budget & MIS

Raw-material budget is prepared, once production budget is made. Current stock and count wise recipe [mix proportion] are considered to workout fiber wise exact quantities to be procured. Raw Material MIS is very useful to track the difference between budgeted and actual consumption of raw material, where the budget is over shoot or under shoot Like sales raw-material MIS is auto prepared with the predictive figures. [hr]

Department Wise Store Budget & MIS

All the department prepare their respective budget for a month. Based on the item group, item names appears for the selection. Further budget can be transferred to the other months and further items can be added / deleted from the particular month. Like sales department wise store MIS is auto prepared with the predictive figures. [hr]

Store Budget All Department & MIS

Based on department wise store budget this budget is prepared for a month and that can be transferred to other months also. Budget shows month wise total value as well as yearly totals. Like sales store MIS for all department is auto prepared with the predictive figures. Material MIS reflects the deviation in quantity and value both. [hr]

HR Budget

System prepares HR budget indicating budgeted and actual strength. [hr]

Power Budget & MIS

Provides budgeted and actual consumption head wise power consumption. Like sales power consumption MIS is auto prepared with the predictive figures. [hr]

Financial Expenses Budget & MIS

In Financial expense budget entries are made for the budgeted interest payable towards CC limit and term loan. At the end of the month like sale, financial expense MIS is auto prepared with the predictive figures.

item.title: Costing & Production Planning
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Costing

Contribution is the difference between yarn sale rate and total variable cost. In order to workout yarn count wise contribution there are many industry specific data required. Namely: yarn recovery percentage, productivity, landed cost of fiber used that too clean raw-material cost [gross raw-material less waste realization] for the spinning along with destination wise ocean freight, local freight, credit period interest etc.

[hr]

âTOPSPINâ ERP Perquisites For Costing

System creates master for fiber rates, cost center wise manufacturing expenses, count wise realization and utilization.

System creates product wise budgeted production norms in consideration with speeds, efficiency, utilization, roving hank/ sliver hank, NIP / minute, feed / lap weight, comber noil, TM, waste percentages to determine assembly and section wise production rate

There are following consideration for market scenario and cost sheet.

[hr]

Review Market Scenario / Cost Sheet

Input: Export/Domestic, Yarn Product, excise applicability, price basis, currency of transaction, rate of product, quantity of product, destination, customer [multiple], recipe of the product [multiple], packing type [multiple], transporter [multiple]

Output: best profitable sale of the product along with their contribution/kg and contribution per spindle per shift to arrive at the most contributing customers and display them in descending order.

[hr]

Costing MIS

Input: Booking No, Invoice No

Output: Costing MIS indicates the difference between budgeted cost considered as per the cost sheet during booking / contract and actual cost incurred right from raw-material mixing stage to sales and dispatches [sale cycle]. This is extremely useful report because based on the cost sheet monthly profitability of the organization is ascertained but after the completion of sales cycle the actual figures may differ and that directly affect the book of account and resultant profit / loss. This indeed is an eye opener for the organization.

[hr]

Production Scheduling

Production schedule is ascertained considering the dispatch requirements in the market ensuring maximum capacityÂ utilisation.

Therefore, in production schedule, count wise machinery allocations are made right from blow room to winding section.

item.title: Marketing & Customer Management
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Marketing

  • System apply tax information and payment terms to be used in preparation of contacts
  • System creates contractual terms and conditions linked with delivery and grace period to identify debit and credit entries i.e. interest and discounts percentages with affective applicable days
  • System enlists customer wise contracts where the consignee may be different and also document and process information regarding foreign / local agent commissions
  • System has the ability to handle sampling with respect to counts, their end usage with detailed description of goods and packing details. System can also prepare contracts for second quality / alarm materials and issue for knitting section
  • Once the contract is prepared, the system immediately indicates the profitability in terms of contribution / kg. of individual product as well as the total profitability of the contract
  • System evaluates profitability against the contract in consideration with credit days, cash discount, machinery utilization, hard waste, packing cost, moisture gain and interest over working capital
  • System evaluate count wise sale targets, confirmed orders received, dispatches made and shortfall
  • System is date sensitive to track information regarding handing over export documents by marketing departments to the accounts and later submission with the concerned bank to claim the proceeds
  • System generates information regarding contract, pending LC, dispatch details along with the expenses incurred towards freight, insurance etc.
  • Application enlist customer complaint and generate lot wise analysis in terms of:
  • Case number wise net and gross weight
  • Variance analysis of budgeted and actual quality norms at different stages of production responsible tenter, supervisor, shift officer
  • Individual fiber characteristics out of the raw-material mix blends to co-relate parameters of the final product i.e. yarn
  • System generates contract wise production order and dispatch instructions with relevant packing and shipping details
  • System permits flexibility to incorporate priorities based on LC status as well as contributions at the thresh hold of dispatches and allow amendment in dispatch instructions
[hr]

Customer Management

  • System has excellent functionality to track customer information world wide that consist:
  • Contract details
  • Contract wise product details
  • Proposal to customer / prospects
  • Contract wise LC details
  • Contract wise production status
  • Contract wise dispatch details
  • Invoice wise complaint
  • Complaint response
  • Payments
  • Sale returns
  • Ledgers
  • View delay in collection of payments

item.title: Production Management
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
• System create assembly wise machine group indicating sides and drums machine wise
  • System generate machine group wise labor deployment information
  • System consider issue of items for a particular machine to maintain and update machine history
  • System maintain important information pertaining to contamination
  • System define assembly and production plan wise process flow in different sections of a production unit
  • System records machine wise production separately in different sections of a production unit
  • System maintain shift and machine wise detentions in consideration with specific reasons like power failure, labor shortage, maintenance, count change etc.
  • System can identify different types of winding faults and also consider drum problems, cuts and ARLT details
  • System maintain production log book
  • System measures conditioning for moisture gain by way of entry and exit in humidex and xorella gain during cotton yarn manufacturing
  • System set packing standards item wise
  • System records lot wise packing details in terms of case numbers, wax / unwaxed and also maintain the information for differentiation like cone tip color, tape color, strip color etc.
  • System packing detail also includes lot and case number wise gross, net and actual weight
  • System maintains weight of unpacked material
  • System records WIP in blow room in consideration with weight of un-opened bales, weight of lay down bales and material in waste opener
  • System maintains WIP machine wise in terms of materials at creel and doff containers as well as containers in queue
  • System maintains WIP of loose stock and packing materials
  • System records section wise different types of waste generated during the production activity

Production management module delivers following reports that are very specific and since they are instant spinners can take tremendous advantages out of that:

  • Production Status [2D â 3D views] reports can be viewed date wise [From Date â To Date], section wise, shift wise, lot/count wise.
  • Production forecasting: This report can be filtered *date wise [From Date â To Date], section wise, quality wise [yarn product]. This report shows the predicted production at the end of the month based on the current rate of production. This also informs the deviation from the production budgets. User can take the necessary steps in order to achieve the targets.
  • Lot Wise Packing And Dispatches: This report can also be viewed from to date, for particular lot. It shows the individual case/ bag/ pallet packing and dispatch info.
  • Daily Production Report: Report can be viewed as on date complete or shift wise production. The report is very useful as it shows today, up to date and average production of each section, that further provides should be production, actual production, overall efficiency % andÂ utilisationÂ %.

Ring frame part shows in detail count wise, number of machines, should be production, actual production, standard gms / spindle / shift and actual gms / spindle / shift.

Overall ring frame utilization and efficiency summary is also there i.e. standard as well as actual

Further TFOT & autoconer efficiency and utilization is also available there.

Other production reports are:

  • Process Stock Summary: as on date section wise WIP is available through this report
  • Daily Detention Report Percentage and minutes from date to date detentions can be viewed
  • Daily Packing Report [as on date, yarn product wise, lot wise] Here lot wise opening, dispatch and closing is maintained for the packed yarn
  • Machine wise production report [summary / detail]
  • Yarn Reconciliation
  • YarnÂ Realisation

item.title: Quality Control
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Creation of Mixing

The system prepares mixing. Hence, recipe is created for particular yarn count ascertaining mix proportions of fiber varieties. Now count wise mixing budgets are prepared in consideration with the recipes

Raw Materials Testing

SQC department performs many important roles with respect to raw materials that consist of naming of quality parameters, benchmark quality standards, records quality parameters, provide grade and prepare requisitions. The quality benchmark contains parameter wise standard values and coefficient of variations in range. This system organizes the same. Raw material quality accounts for around 65 to 70 % of the cost and significantly contributes the quality of yarns.

  • System permits creation of section wise general check points and routine tests
  • System conduct in process testing to facilitate different type of test conducted in various sections at different stages of production. This starts with records blow room cleaning efficiencies indicating trash and lint percentages in case of cotton fiber.
  • System has provision to study simplex breakages and record bottom, middle and top breakages separately and calculate total breakages /100 SPL / HR
  • System perform simplex stretch study, machine and carded / combed yarn wise and calculate average, front and back, top and bottom, stretch along with stretch percentages for front and back row
  • System perform UT-3 test to document nominal and actual count, count CV, CSP, U%, UCVB%, CVM, CVM [CV%], CVM [3m], CVM [3m] CV%, CVM [10m], CVM [10m] CV%, thin / KM NEPS / KM, total IPI hairiness, hairiness CV, RKM, RKM- CV%, elongation, elongation CV%, nominal TPI, actualÂ  TPI, TPI-CV%, TM and twist loss
  • System allow ring frame breakage study with reasons and segregation of top, bottom, middle LHS & RHS to calculate total breakages / spindle hour
  • System allow ring frame step wise breakage study to calculate total breakages / 100 spindle / hour
  • System permits peak spindle, ' D â shaped, idle spindle percentages
  • System documents shift wise ring frame fan waste percentage
  • System document top and bottom apron damages ring frame / side / spindle wise
  • System allow ring frame machinery wise instruction details and its monitoring

Trial

  • System allow trial study and viz a viz draw comparison

Autoconer

  • System allows classimate testing over auto coner machinery. The results are documented Ring frame & Autoconer machine, count & lot wise at bobbin & cone stages indicating parameter on left or right position.
  • System provide process checking over auto coner machinery count and lot wise in consideration with speeds, cone tip and conacity
  • System creates clearer setting parameters and document UQC, UPC, UPM lot and individual drum wise
  • System allow re-winding breakage study to calculate total re-winding length in km's and total breakages / 100 KMs.
  • System indicates high joint cuts and low efficiency over auto coner machinery drum wise
  • System allow drum wise cone hardness checks indicating bottom and top dia as well as bottom, middle and top hardness
  • System perform bobbin vs. cone study in terms of percentage deviation, thick-thin places, neps, total imperfection and hairiness
  • System allow count and lot wise moisture checking through dry oven and weight gain methods
  • System permit wrapping at preparatory, ring frame and post spinning stages
  • System allow individual cone weight checking, count and lot wise
  • System permits visual cone checking count, lot and carton wise indicating tailends, twisted hair, jute fiber twist and other parameters to calculate rejection percentages
  • System documents count, lot and shift wise carton weight checking
  • System allow inspection for incoming packing materials like carton, polythene and paper cones
  • System permit testing and inspection of purchased yarn used for merchant exports
  • System documents pre-shipment inspection count / lot wise to arrive at fault percentages
  • System permit fabric inspection and testing
  • System generates various extremely important reports. The most significant is Raw material bargain analysis that converge techno-commercial information at a common platform i.e. Raw material variety, grade wise fiber quality index, landed cost and expenses details all put together. Since raw material cost is 65-70 % of total cost of yarn, these vital information play a very significant role in bargain analysis and there by raw material procurements. A little reduction shall contribute huge savings that itself alone may payback ROI in ERP.

item.title: vEvolve
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
vEvolve

The world is ever changing, so should be your enterprise software.

[hr]

[tabs style="vertical"]Â [tab title="What's vEvolve?"]vEvolve is a wonderfully simple yet revolutionary piece of technology built to stay relevant withstanding the only constant in the world, change.

It's more than just a software, it's the representation of your vision for your business.

With vEvolve you are in control to keep, remove or change anything you like within vEvolve.

You no longer need to keep in touch with ERP teams, discussing requirement, our documentations are enough to guide you through creating exactly the kind of system you want... Without ever writing a line of code!

[/tab] [tab title="Well Suited For Your Business"]Well Suited For Your Business content goes here.[/tab] [tab title="Built To Be Fully Customisable"]Built To Be Fully Customisable content goes here.[/tab] [tab title="Easy On The Mind And The Pockets"]Easy On The Mind And The Pockets content goes here.[/tab] [/tabs]

item.title: Vlog Camera
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[dt_gap height="15" /]

[dt_divider style="thick" /]

[dt_gap height="10" /]

What is Vlog Camera?

Vlog CameraÂ is an extremely simple to use application with which you can create great looking videos in no time. With multiple video effect filters, literally, one tap away, you can experiment with creating very interesting videos instantly. Applying effects while recording also eliminates the need to apply effects during editing and reduces reliance on video editing application so that you can focus on content rather than figuring out how to deal with these difficult to use editing applications.

We figured out that the effects that are now available are great for use however this phenomenon can really explode if the no. of effects is enhanced. So we've decided we will soon be putting up an effects marketplace as well as an effect creator functionality (all inside the app). These effects can then be shared with other users so that everyone can benefit from what you've created. Also there will be infinite no. of effects to create or download from the effect marketplace therefore leading to infinite possibilities while creating videos without any need to go to a computer for anything at all!

So you can go to the app store on the 10th January, 2014 and download the Vlog CameraÂ application proudly created by us. Which marks our foray into mainstream mobile apps for the people who want apps which can help them create content on a mobile device levying the power of today's devices.

[dt_divider style="thin" /]

[dt_gap height="10" /]

Default Effects

item.title: Maintenance Management
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
• System creates maintenance schedule containing activities check list and action taken
  • System prepares specific maintenance schedule and link the same to the activities
  • System configure machine settings section wise and differentiate parameter wise standard, running and current values
  • System document section and machine wise observations and issue instructions accordingly and simultaneously monitor the action taken
  • System enlist scheduled, specific and additional maintenance activities
  • System manages sub-stores receipt and issue to a particular machine and simultaneously updates machine history. System also document the replaced items and convert the same to scrap
  • System allow trials of machinery parts, vendor wise and record the remarks from maintenance and quality control departments
  • System monitor repairing expenses
  • System documents service engineer details as well as their expenses
  • System allow testing and inspection of incoming materials as per ISO standards
  • System consist smart finders to evaluate maintenance schedule status
  • System prepare projected job card
  • System generate reports for schedule job card, maintenance registers and consumptions
  • System documents vendor queries and suggestions
  • System prepare budgets for item consumptions, repairing, AMC / services and capital expenses
  • System compare actual consumptions with the budget, cost center wise
  • System review maintenance activities in terms of quality and productivity, before and after maintenance

item.title: Engineering Management
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
• System records air pressure and leakages
  • System prepare engineering budget considering the past records and recommend for the current financial year
  • System records electricity tripping, fluctuations, power factor, maximum demand, minimum and maximum frequency
  • System record own generated power units and fuel consumed
  • System creates power consumption heads like compressors, humidity plant etc. and also recognize multiplying factor
  • System consider section wise machineries under a power consumption head and record the electricity consumed
  • System records compressor running hours
  • System monitor engineering maintenance activities
  • System prepare engineering maintenance check list and schedules for productive and utility machines as well as humidification plant
  • System records engineering break down, maintenance shift / section / machine wise along with the time and action report
  • System manages engineering sub stores that consist indent, requisition and issue
  • System check machinery speeds and motor overload
  • System monitor motor overload details with reasons and action taken to prevent or reduce motor burn outs
  • System enlist workshop jobs, allocate expense budget and fix priorities
  • System maintains group and head wise power generation and consumption. Since each machine is linked under a specific group and based on that system calculate the power consumption of individual machine
  • System monitor workshop jobs priorities and indicate pending jobs
  • System generate following important reports:
    • Power consumption and daily engineering reports
    • DG Wise Generated Unit

item.title: Raw-Materials Management
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
System has separate provisions of domestic procurements and imports for cotton and man-made fiber Once the production plan is ascertained, system calculates raw-materials to be ordered after due consideration to stock and quantities in pipeline. Natural Fiber Procurements System allow cotton bargains and its amendments Cotton bargains are maintained variety and ginner wise to document quality parameters wise, approval / pressing date and press running numbers in the system. Such cotton fiber bargains consist variety wise payment terms expenses like commission, spot expenses, carrying, sorting and loading charges, go-down rent, transit insurance etc. System allow to prepare raw-material bill register, vendor / ginner / bargain number wise Raw-material bill register consist lot and press running number wise weighment sheet System evaluate inventories based on moving weighted average method System provides cotton fiber requisition, variety / lot / bale wise in consideration with micronier, strength, length, rd, maturity and uniformity ratio Synthetic Fiber Procurements System generate bargain for synthetic fibers in consideration with denier, length and shades System prepare synthetic fiber bill register, brand and bale wise in terms of shade, denier and length System document vendor packing list indicating bale number wise gross, tare, net weight and moisture System allow variety/shade/ denier/ length wise issue slip and also accommodate loose issue instead of full bale System automates debit / credit notes for rate & weight differences System generate bale wise mixing report indicating moisture and net weight separately System consist a comprehensive materials management that suits to the textile industry specific requirements System automate vendor bill approvals as per contractual terms and conditions System account for applicable taxes and duties separately along with the cost of purchases, item wise System maintains weight and per kgs. rate of each and every bale. Bale can beÂ  issued in parts also Raw Material module has following very useful reports: Ageing report: that keeps record of raw-material in stock according to its date of purchase and further in stock days fromÂ  0 to 30, 31 to 60, 61 To 90 and above Some other useful reports are:
  • Bargain Register
  • Stock Position
  • Inventory Statement
  • RM Stock Statement

item.title: StoreâMaterials Management
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
• System creates item category & group them cost center wise
  • System has a separate provision for OEM vendors and their items
  • System send enquiries to desired vendors
  • System documents quotation received from the vendors & automatically prepares a comparison chart
  • System place orders to the desired vendors
  • System has the provision for order amendment & follow ups
  • System enlist challan at gate entry
  • System prepares store bill register
  • System document bill of entry in case of imports
  • System enlist agent invoices
  • System prepares material receipt report [MRR] with goods approval & enter the expenses incurred
  • System has the provision of goods rejection, shortage & excess memo
  • System prepares credit / debit note
  • System also prepare utility bill register
  • System has provision to generate returnable & non returnable gate pass
  • System receives scrap materials separately
  • System can issue loans to the employees & also prepare loan register
  • System calculate closing stock quantity & value on the basis of moving weighted average
  • System enlist requisitions from user departments
  • System enlist indent from user departments
  • System prepare issue slip
  • System has convenient item search
A few useful reports generated from store module are:
  • Item wise stock
  • Comparison of quotations that depicts the landed item wise cost of the vendors
  • Pending indent
  • Consumption statement
  • Closing balance as on
  • Stock ledger
  • Indent analysis
  • Purchase register common

item.title: Sales & Dispatches
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Sales organize preparation of different types of packing list and invoices. This also includes export documentation and issue of debit & credit notes. To name few of them:

  • System allow sale of yarns, waste sale, scrap, raw-material and captive consumption [business unit transfers] separately. Yarn sales consist:
    • Export sale
      • Direct export
      • Deemed / Merchant export
    • Domestic sales
      • Direct sales to customer
        • Fresh yarn
        • Second / alarm material
        • Consignment sales
        • Transit sales
  • System permit depot sale and yarn trading

System automates debit and credit note against weight, rate difference against yarn sold as well as sale returns

Following type of sales can be managed through âTOPSPINâ ERP sales management module

  • Export sale contains
    • Create LC
    • Create export packing list (plant)
    • Â Create export invoice (plant). The invoice is automatically prepared as the data is retrieved from the packing list. The later is prepared against dispatch instructions issued from the marketing department against a contract finalized with the buyer. The invoice has multi currency option and stores all the relevant data required.
    • Create export packing list (commercial)
    • Create export commercial invoice
    • ARE I/ ARE III
    • Annexure C-I
    • Create foreign agent commission
    • Conduct lead time analysis
  • Domestic Sale
    • Create DTA packing list
    • Create DTA invoice
  • Merchant Export
    • Create merchant commercial packing list
    • Create merchant invoice
  • Deemed ExportÂ Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â 
    • Create deemed packing list
    • Create export invoice
  • Stock Transfer through captive consumption for fiber and yarn from one business unit to another
    • Captive consumption invoice
  • Sample SaleÂ Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â 
    • Create sample packing list
    • Create sample invoice
  • Second Quality & Alarm Material SaleÂ Â Â Â Â Â Â 
    • Create second quality packing list
    • Create second quality invoice
  • Waste Sale
    • Organize waste contract
    • Issue waste dispatch instruction
    • Create waste packing list
    • Create waste invoice
  • Raw materials Sale
    • Create raw material packing list
    • Create raw material invoice
  • Store Material Scrap SaleÂ Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â 
    • Create scrap packing list
    • Create scrap invoice
  • Debit / Credit NotesÂ Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â 
    • Issue credit note towards rate differences
    • Issue credit note against sale returns
    • Issue credit note towards weight differences
    • Issue debit note against rate differences
    • Issue debit note towards weight differences

Few important reports include:

  • Sales Analysis Report [Summary and Detail]
  • Delay in collection of payments: *Date Wise [From Date â To Date] Customer wise / Invoice wise received payment
  • Cancelled contract review: *Date Wise [From Date â To Date] contract type wise
  • Sales Status Domestic/Export *Date Wise [From Date â To Date]
  • Count Wise Sale [Domestic / Export] *Date Wise [From Date â To Date] invoice wise, product wise details
  • Country Wise Sales Report: Date Wise [From Date â To Date]
  • DTA Dispatch Register Lot Wise dispatch information wise dispatch detail with packing detail
  • Waste Sales: *Date Wise [From Date â To Date]
  • Waste Dispatched: *Date Wise [From Date â To Date]: Contract Wise: Waste dispatch detail quantity wise [including balance quantity]
  • Sales Register Common: *Date Wise [From Date â To Date], Form Wise [C, F, H, E1, D3]
  • Head Wise [Sales Type], Tax Wise [CST/VAT]: Report shows invoice wise records [including tax info. And excise info that too wise Customer and product wise.
  • Pending Contract Register: *Date Wise [From Date â To Date]: Can search pending, cancelled, closed and completed contract
  • Top Selling Products
  • Sales Tax Statement
  • Statement of Excise duty debit
  • Delay in collection of payment

Dispatch Detail as on: Dispatch instruction number wise records with customer name, yarn product, lotno, packing type, quantity, transporter and freight details.

item.title: Human Resource Management
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Employee Recognition
  • System create category and grade wise designation as well as skilled designation.
  • System enlist contractor and contractor wise worker detail
Recruitment
  • System can recruit employee and create master information, which also consist educational and professional qualifications, experience, contact details, references, nominee, salary and other important details.Â  Employee photograph can be uploaded in employee master.
  • Similar to employee master, contractor worker details may also be stored in database.
  • System documents certificate of fitness.
HR Budget
  • System prepares HR budget in consideration with heads created and sections allocated.
Leave & Attendance
  • System creates different types of leave dynamically and customizes their nature. System has the ability to consider leave applications and their approval.
  • System enlist department and section wise manpower sanctioned strength & mark attendance for staff and workers separately.Â  Textile is a labor-intensive industry and the attendance play a key role to calculate worker wages and attendance incentives. In certain circumstances the worker of one designation and section perform duty for another designation and may be in a different section. Hence, there is a separate provision for multi skilled attendance.
Good Work & CPL
  • System takes care of good work and CPL
Salary & Wages
  • System creates designation wise rate master and fix earning and deduction criteria. Apart From The Fixed Criteria's, The System Customize Additional Earning And Deduction Criteria. The system dynamically creates variable earning and deduction heads and customizes their nature. System also creates monthly earning and deduction criteria
  • System addresses specific business rule regarding wages preparation if the employee of one designation switch over the job to a different designation and work profile temporarily.
  • The salary and wages are prepared instantly through a convenient process if the attendance and leaves data are available. System automatically prepares salary and wages slip once the salary / wages process is over.
  • System takes care of leave and earning areas and document contractors bill.
  • The system is also capable of preparing incentives for attendance and machine / count wise production. System also arranges earned and CPL leaves encashment.
  • System accounts for HR expenses.
Security
  • System permits gate entry of raw material and store material separately. The system is vigilant about employee movement, outward materials, visitors and vehicles

HR Reports

  • The system generates report over HR budget and expenses. The system also generates various important reports for employees, their leaves, attendance, salary and wages, good work and CPL, arrears, bonus, ESI, PF & gratuity. System prepares a detailed report over the activities performed at the factory gate.

item.title: Financial & Excise Matter
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
System takes care of complete book keeping, taxation asset management and excise matter. The system begins with:
  • Creation Of Groups & Ledgers to view chart of accounts
  • The system has provision for separate vouchers. Namely:
  • Bank payment voucher
  • Cash payment voucher
  • Bank receipt voucher
  • Cash receipt voucher
  • Journal voucher
  • Contra voucher
    • System generates debit/credit note as per the contract / purchase order
Sale voucher
  • Export sale voucher
  • Merchant sale voucher
  • DTA sale voucher
  • Other sale voucher
Purchase Voucher
  • Raw materials purchase
  • Store purchase
  • System display and integrates raw-material, store purchases, service & utilities bills, debit /credit notes and sales invoices to book keeping through selection and posting of pending vouchers
  • There is a provision for document negotiation with bank to identify delay in collection
  • System conducts raw-material price and quantity as well as sales analysis
  • System has the provision to identify sales tax forms & their inventors
  • System can identify heads for tax deduction & collection at source
  • System takes care of asset management through creation of asset block and preparation of fixed asset register.
Reports
  • System conveniently finds party ledgers
  • System helps to find various documents based on the transactions
  • System deliver ledger summary, cash book, daily cash balances, bank book
  • The system takes care of cash/fund flow statements and daybook.
  • System calculates depreciation as per IT & company act
  • System generate trial balance
  • System prepares profit & loss a/c, balance sheet [general]
  • System can also prepare scheduled balance sheet through creation of schedule's & configuration
  • System highlights insurance & interest detail (purchase / sale)
  • System takes care of VAT, Central Sales tax, statuary forms and registers
  • System accounts for interest details over purchases.
  • System prepares statement of TDS
  • System delivers outstanding statement of creditor's & debtor's
  • System enlists outstanding of export bill discounting, receivable and payables.

Absenteeism Textile industry being a labor intensive one always has a cautious approach towards the scarcity of labor. The absenteeism displays the annual trend for the HR Executives to monitor the attendance and absenteeism record.

Money

Measures

    • Inspection details

  • Bargain analysis
  • Technical variance analysis
  • Budgeted profitability statement
  • Count wise profitability
  • Customer complaint details

item.title: Functionalities
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
The prime benefits to the spinners using âTOPSPINâ ERP is the instant availability of resource wise information to obtain absolute management controls ensuring. ATWSPL is elaborating the resource wise functionalities to understand the benefits as under: Market:
  • Market scenario based product costing based on following data
    • INCOTERMS
    • Fiber Mix Proportion [Recipe]
    • On-payment or without payment of excise duty
    • Sales tax applicability
    • Transportation type
    • Transportation cost
    • Packing types
    • Budgeted production norms [count and machine wise gms./ spindle or rotor]
    • Currency exchange rate in case of exports
    • Export incentives
  • Sale contract review
  • Count / customer wise sales graph
  • Contract and count wise contributions
  • Pending contract review
  • Sales MIS
Materials:
  • Dynamic product creation
  • Lot wise, variety wise and bale wise weight taking and stock
  • Provision for breaking up of bale and issuing of bale multiple no. of times
  • Completely automated Form-IV from RM purchase and RM issue entries
  • Completely automated generation of consumption http://essaytypers.net vouchers from RM Issue
  • Completely automated stock reports and stock ledger maintenance
  • Cotton raw-material station / ginner wise bargain analysis to ascertain fiber quality index [FQI] with corresponding landed cost and expense details
  • Lot wise cotton fiber quality parameters at mixing stage
  • Raw-material monthly purchases
  • Age wise raw-material inventory
  • Raw-material MIS
  • Store consumptions [cost center and consumption head wise]
  • Store item wise under / over stock and re-order levels
  • Indent analysis [store items indented but not lifted]
  • Pending indents
  • Inventory calculation (item wise)
  • Automated bin card
  • Store MIS department wise
  • Materials MIS
Machine:
  • Technical variance analysis considering production, raw-material consumptions, energy consumption considering ring frame /open end and packed production
  • Technical variance analysis of yarn quality based on Uster test results
  • Yarn test comparative study at bobbin and cone stage with summary and detailed analysis
  • Fiber / yarn co-relation i.e. fiber quality index [FQI] viz a viz yarn quality index [YQI]in case of cotton yarn
  • Ring frame breakage study
  • Daily production reports [count and machine wise] at different stages of production indicating budgeted and actual production, utilization and efficiency details
  • Current production dash board
  • Predictive production graph based on current rate of production
  • Plant maintenance review against the scheduled job cards
  • Power MIS
  • Production MIS
Man:
  • Employee recruitment details indicating experience, age, territory, reference etc.
  • Budgeted vs. actual worker strength
  • Sanctioned labor strength in a month
  • Section wise labor deployment
  • Staff and worker muster roll
  • Absenteeism monitoring
Money:
  • Vouchers [cash receipt / payment, bank receipt / bank payment, journal, contra, raw-material and store purchase, domestic and export sales, debit and credit notes.
  • Cash book
  • Bank book
  • Journal book
  • Ledger summary
  • Trial balance
  • Profit and loss statement
  • Balance sheet
  • Budgeted and actual profitability
  • Count wise profitability
  • Sales tax statement
  • Pending sales tax forms [C, H, E1, F] with pre-programmed reminders
  • Statement of excise duty debited
  • RG 1 Yarn / waste
  • RG 23 A Part II
  • RG 23 C Part II
  • Service tax credit register

item.title: Benefits
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
ERP is an acronym that stands for Enterprise Resource Planning. ERP is package software solution that addresses the enterprise needs of an organization by tightly integrating the various functions of an organization using a process view of the organization.
  • Integration [Abolish reducing data redundancy and redundant data entry]
  • Seamless Integration & de-compartmentalization of different departments to abolish communication gaps
  • Converged techno-commercial information for scientific & quick decision making
  • Improve alignment of strategies and operations
  • Accuracy
  • Improvement in efficiency
  • Cost reductionÂ through increased flexibility
  • Reduction in manpower
  • Improve productivity and insight
  • Reduce costs
  • Support changing industry requirements
  • Reduce risk
  • Improve financial management and corporate governance
  • Retain top performers
  • Auto generated online MIS
  • Financial gains and losses
  • Variance analysis
  • Historical comparisons
Future Strategic information
  • Increase in production per spindle required to recover additional cost per candy in case of cotton fiber and per kg for synthetic fiber.
  • Increase in mixing cost and its impact over cost of production and yarn selling price
  • Components of conversion cost and their impact over various operational factors.
  • Increase in utilization, production per spindle and resultant savings per spindle per year.
  • Causes and quantum of losses in terms of utilization, idle spindle per day, stoppages etc.
  • Increase in yarn selling price and its impact over net realizations count wise [carded and combed in case of cotton yarn]
  • Wage bill and productivity index
  • Increase in yarn selling price or production per spindle to require break even in terms of escalation of power cost per kilo watt hour.
  • Increase in spindle speed and power consumption
  • Additional cost because of coarser count and higher weight
  • Corresponding impact due to doff weight, ancillary labour and hard waste.
Additional advantages
  • Formidable user administration
  • Dynamic search from database
  • Product tracking through optional bar-coding
  • Drill-down access of related transactions
  • Audit trail to safeguard modifications
  • Minimizes paper work

item.title: Implementation Methodology
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
TOPSPIN ERP Platinum can be implemented in two distinct phases as well. This may help organizations to ensure their investments phase wise. Other TOPSPIN products can be implemented using the same basic methodology eliminating the modules that are not accompanied with the particular product. Ist phase for commercial activities includes following modules:
  • General Setup
  • Procurements
    • Raw-Material & waste [If required]
    • Store Material with complete materials management
    • Marketing & customer management
    • Production
      • Raw-materials requisition, issue & mixing
      • Lot creation
      • Packing
    • Sales & dispatches
    • Finance
      • Financial Accouting [Book keeping]
      • Excise
      • Sales Tax
      • Service Tax
      • TDS
    • Management Information System [MIS]
      • Variance analysis commercial performance [for implemented modules]
IInd phase for technical activities includes following modules:
  • Management Accounting
    • Budgeting
    • Costing & Production Planning
    • Manufacturing [Production Scheduling, recording & Control]
    • Manufacturing Support Services
      • Statistical Quality Control
      • Maintenance management
      • Engineering management [specifically power consumption details]
    • Management Information Systems [MIS]
      • Variance Analysis technical modules
    • Human Resource Management
    • Strategic Information Management System

item.title: Detailed Project Management Regime
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
ERP Project Steps

Step II [if required]

âTOPSPINâ ERP statement of scope submission:

ERP statement of scope consist all the domains of the activities performed in different departments of textile spinning industry.

1.1.Â Â Â Â Â Â  General Setup

1.2.Â Â Â Â Â Â  Management accounting that consist âBudgetingâ to facilitate budgetary controls

1.3.Â Â Â Â Â Â  Marketing & Customer Management

1.4.Â Â Â Â Â Â  Costing & Production Planning

1.5.Â Â Â Â Â Â  Supply Chain Management

1.5.1.Â  Procurements

1.5.1.1.Â Â Â Â  Raw âMaterials

1.5.1.1.1.Â Â Â Â  Fiber

1.5.1.1.2.Â Â Â Â  Waste [if required]

1.5.1.2.Â Â Â Â  Store âMaterials with complete materials management

1.5.2.Â  Manufacturing [Production Planning & Control]

1.5.3.Â  Manufacturing Support Services

1.5.3.1.Â Â Â Â  Statistical Quality Control

1.5.3.2.Â Â Â Â  Maintenance

1.5.3.3.Â Â Â Â  Engineering [highlighting power consumption details]

1.5.4.Â  Sales & Dispatches to facilitate export & different type of domestic sale[Also consistsÂ export documentation & LC coordination]

1.5.5.Â  Inventory Evaluation

1.5.5.1.Â Â Â Â  Fiber

1.5.5.2.Â Â Â Â  WIP

1.5.5.3.Â Â Â Â  Yarns

1.5.5.4.Â Â Â Â  Waste

1.5.5.5.Â Â Â Â  Store Materials

1.5.5.6.Â Â Â Â  Scrap

1.6.Â Â Â Â Â Â  Human Resource Management

1.7.Â Â Â Â Â Â  Financial Management [Consist Financial Accounting with Fixed Assets, TDS, VAT/Sales Tax, Service Tax, Excise]

1.8.Â Â Â Â Â Â  Management information system [MIS]

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  Configurations to deliver variances for absolute management controls through new reporting

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  system based on real time data that reflects future deviations from budgeted figures in

Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â  advance to exercise management controls in terms of:

1.8.1.Â  Production

1.8.2.Â  Quality

1.8.3.Â  Budgetary controls

1.8.4.Â  Product and bokking /parta [Cost Sheet]

1.9.Â  Strategic Information System pertaining to Market, Man, Machine, Materials, Money & Measures

1.10. Â Optional Priority

Reflex a web based powerful tool to generate alerts in browser mode as well as mobile instant messaging. It also consist a personal organiser for each and every user of âTOPSPINâ ERP

The project will be broadly implemented in two distinct phases i.e. commercial and technical. The details are as under:

2.1.Â  1st phase for commercial activities includes following modules:

2.1.1.Â Â Â Â  General Setup

2.1.2.Â Â Â Â  Procurements

2.1.2.1.Raw-Material & waste [If required]

2.1.2.2.Store Material with complete materials management

2.1.3.Â Â Â Â  Marketing & customer management

2.1.4.Â Â Â Â  Production

2.1.4.1.Raw-materials requisition, issue & mixing

2.1.4.2.Lot creation

2.1.4.3.Packing

2.1.5.Â Â Â Â  Sales & dispatches

2.1.6.Â Â Â Â  Finance & excise

2.1.7.Â Â Â Â  Management Information System [MIS]

2.1.7.1.Variance analysis commercial performance [for implemented modules]

2.2.Â  2nd phase for technical activities includes following modules:

2.2.1.Â Â Â Â  Costing & production planning

2.2.2.Â Â Â Â  Budgeting for remaining modules

2.2.3.Â Â Â Â  Human Resource Management

2.2.4.Â Â Â Â  Manufacturing [Production Scheduling & Control]

2.2.5.Â Â Â Â  Manufacturing Support Services

2.2.5.1.Statistical Quality Control

2.2.5.2.Maintenance

2.2.5.3.Engineering [specifically power consumption details]

2.2.6.Â Â Â Â  Budgeting for implemented modules

2.2.7.Â Â Â Â  Management Information Systems [MIS]

2.2.7.1.Variance Analysis technical modules

2.3.Â  Strategic Information System pertaining to Market, Man, Machine, Materials, Money & Measures

2.4.Â  Optional Priority

Reflex a web based powerful tool to generate alerts in browser mode as well as mobile instant messaging. It also consist a personal organizer for each and every user of âTOPSPINâ ERP

3. Project Resources

  • People
  • Hardware & System Software,
  • NetworkingÂ  & Remote Connectivity [point to point minimum 2MBPS dedicated or MPLS]

3.1.Â  People

Industry Specific ERP project will require team from ATWSPL and PROSPECTS in order to finish the assignment in around 06 months. Team members will have to work in an interrelated network environment (ego-less) where everyone needs to communicate with everyone else on the regular basis. Hence a coordination committee will be required to successfully utilize the human resource.

3.1.1. Â Coordination Committee

ATWSPL and Prospects will jointly appoint a coordination committee in order to address all the issues pertaining to the customization and implementation of Industry Specific ERP.

3.1.2. Â Identification Of Hardware & System Software [Minimum requirements]

3.1.2.1. Â User Client-side

Industry specific ERP compatible hardware minimum configuration & Microsoft

software requirements will be as under:

Dual core computers with 3.2 Ghz processor, 800 FSB and minimum 1 GB RAM

Operating System Windows 7/XP

MS Office 2003 / 2007 / 2010

Existing computers with minimum 512 MB RAM can also be utilized.

3.1.2.2. Â Â User Server-sideÂ 

âTOPSPIN [Industry specific] ERP compatible server minimum configuration and Microsoft software requirements will be as under:

Server [Specifications to be submitted after gap analysis]

Windows 2003 / 2008 /2008 R2 with required CAL for Client

SQL Server 2005 / 2008 /2008 R2 with required CAL for Client

Crystal report 11/ above

3.1.3. Â NetworkingÂ  & Remote Connectivity

3.1.3.1.Network's Infrastructure includes the physical hardware used to transmit data at remote locations electronically such as switches and hubs or a wireless network. As far as connectivity is concerned, âTOPSPINâ [Industry Specific] ERP requires point-to-point dedicated connectivity of 02 [Two] MBPS or MPLS for data transfer from remote location to the centralized data server.

3.1.3.2. Â Running of diagnostic routines successfully will do acceptance test for networking accessories, cabling and connectivity.Â  Prospects will arrange operational network and connectivity well before Industry Specific ERP installations.

3.1.3.3. Â ATWSPL Requirements At Site

ATWSPL team will also require a separate sitting room at prospects site having one computer per person of visiting team along with intercom and call facility on demand, Internet connectivity over at least one system, one laser printer and required stationary etc.

4. Â GAP Analysis

âTOPSPIN ERP project begins with GAP analysis to identify organization requirement viz a viz existing âTOPSPIN, ERP application. ATWSPL will conduct detailed âGAP Analysisâ comprising following major activities as per system statement of scope:

4.1.Identification Of Resource Person For Gap Analysis

Prospects will hand over a list of resource person department wise so that the ATWSPL team can interact with them. Coordination committee will beÂ  required to monitor the study deliberations based on a format submitted by ATWSPL that consist the monitoring details of time devoted by the resource person during interactions.

4.2.Preparation & Submission Of GAP Analysis Interpretation Document

Gap analysis being the most critical area must be addressed adequately in terms of time schedule and clarity. Hence, team of ATWSPL will interact with the resource persons of PROSPECTS and submit an interpretation document in text format daily. Resource persons of prospects will approve the same in writing. On completion of interpretation activity, ATWSPL will submit gap analysis report with the prospects and the same will be treated as the base document for any references in future including customizations.

4.3.Implementation & Customization

ATWSPL team will deploy âTOPSPINâ ERP application at prospects location and as per the requirement of prospects, ATWSPL will customize the same. The terms & conditions related to implementation & customizations are mentioned in the commercial proposal in detail. ERP implementation will also consist the following activities. Namely:

4.3.1.Â Â Â Â  Selection Of Implementation Team

Prospects will hand over the list of team for ERP implementation to ATWSPL

4.3.2.Â Â Â Â  Implementation Strategy

The implementation will be divided in maximum four increments. The details of such increments will be submitted in consideration with gap analysis report. A list of milestones and deliverables will also be submitted by ATWSPL to the prospects at this stage of ERP project.

4.3.3. Installation

âTOPSPINâ industry specific ERP increments after the ALPHA test will be installed by the ATWSPL team at prospects locations.

4.3.4.Testing & approval

4.3.4.1.The codes will be tested on the basis of ALPHA test at ATWSPL lab so that the construction of customized application may be released for the PROSPECTS users who in turn make BETA testing at prospects site through data entry and report reconciliation to issue approval letters

4.3.4.2.During BETA testing prospects will ensure timely data feeding in the system. Data feeding will be monitored by the coordination committee over a prescribed format submitted by the ATWSPL. Delay in data feeding can cause project over shoot and hence prospects will use its administrative powers to ensure timely compliances of data feeding assignments. ATWSPL cannot be held responsible towards the same

4.3.4.3.During BETA testing bugs will be identified. Such identified bugs will be communicated to the ATWSPL over a prescribed bug removal format [only] for removal as well as monitoring of bugs removed.

4.3.4.4.ATWSPL will remove the bugs. The individual data input screen and output will be tested, reports reconciled and approved by the prospects simultaneously.

4.3.5.Approval & Final Acceptance

Prospects will issue a letter of approval to ATWSPL as final acceptance.

5.ATWSPL Support & Training During âTOPSPINâ ERP Project

ATWSPL will provide all possible support to the prospects during the entire project life cycle. ATWSPL team will submit a system flow diagram with the concerned users so that they may understand the data flow and pre-requisites.

ATWSPL will provide on the job training and demonstrate data entry and then the users will enter data before the team. Only relevant or live data will be entered so that data sanctity can be ascertained. Later in case users find any difficulty in entering data, they may contact ATWSPL implementation team. When ATWSPL team is not available at site the users may interact using virtual software like team viewer to resolve their problems.

ATWSPL team will organize separate training sessions for top management and the database administrator [DBA].

Moreover, prospects will arrange training for fundamental computer operations to their ERP users.

5.1.Selection Of DBA

Database Administrator (DBA) will be required to maintain database and re-training to the users. ATWSPL will support in selection of DBA if required.

Â

item.title: What Is Web Hosting And Why It Is So Important?
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: One of the things new webmasters are expected to know is what is web hosting and how to choose the right type and provider. The provider aka host company is the one who has the infrastructure in place for making websites accessible to users on the world wide web. Thatâs why a hosted website starts with the www, as in www.oursite.com. The concept is that the website docs and files are stored on the host machine which has an internet server solution like IIS or Apache installed on it. The hostâs name servers are registered with the websiteâs domain registrars, and this helps ensure that the internetâs DNS servers are able to route data between the hostâs server and the websiteâs visitors who can be anywhere in the world. Those not interested in geeky stuff like this can safely let it go by, because it isnât really necessary. But what is necessary is to know whatâs needed in a good web hosting package and who to get it from. In a nutshell, the webmaster has to balance the websiteâs tech requirements against the available budget, and make sure the provider is reliable and offers adequate support. An ordinary personal website or a simple one for a small company wonât need anything more than the shared hosting package that is commonly used. It hardly costs anything, and provides enough disk space and bandwidth for a simple website, along with all the tools that may be needed for setting up and running the site. For instance, if thereâs a blog or eCommerce store associated with the site, then scripts that need a database may have to be installed. But if the website has more complex needs, then a basic shared package may not be sufficient. In this case, more powerful solutions such as VPS, a dedicated server or hosting on the cloud may be needed. The resources available are massive (think unlimited space and bandwidth on a powerful machine), and customers have administrative rights including root access. Itâs possible to choose everything from the OS (Windows or Linux) to the web server. Of course, the price tag is bigger too. Another choice that can be made here is whether to go for a managed server or one that is unmanaged. If it is managed, the host company handles the administrative duties including backups and security. With unmanaged servers, the customer is responsible for administration. The choice of host company depends on the pricing structure for the packages, and the hostâs location â itâs better for the host to be in the same area as the websiteâs targeted demographic. Also to be considered is the hostâs reputation and reliability, which can be verified via review sites. Knowing what is web hosting and getting these decisions right is as good a way as any to start off with an online venture, even if itâs not really a big deal these days. It is still a good thing, though.
